results.title: Engine bearing manufacture
results.creator_credit: Repco Engine Parts Group Technical Film and Cine Service
results.brief_description: The processes involved in the manufacture of bearings and bushes for all types of automobiles are explained. The works are in Tasmania and 600 different types of bearing sets are produced. The trade is not only within Australia, orders are received from the East. Africa, USA and Germany.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Repco Engine Parts Group Technical Film and Cine Service

results.title: Energy: towards the age of abundance
results.creator_credit: Peter Thurling, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel, Hobel-Leiterman Productions and ACI Films
results.brief_description: As traditional energy sources dwindle we must look to such alternatives as nuclear fission, tidal power and solar energy.

results.title: Energy: the problems and the future
results.brief_description: Each of the four basic elements - water, earth, wind and fire of the sun - is a possible energy source for the future. The film shows developments in France with housing designs and tidal power.

results.title: Energy: the dilemma. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Provides a well-balanced overview of the current world energy crisis. Looks at the various energy options which are available (oil, coal, natural gas, nuclear) and the problems asociated with the use of each of these power resources.

results.title: Energy: new sources. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith, Robert Churchill and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Looks at potential alternatives to our present dependence on fossil fuels, such as solar energy, nuclear fusion, geothermal and synthetic fuels. The future of the world’s energy supplies is cast in an optimistic light.

results.title: Energy: less is more. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith, Robert Churchill and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Looks at various ways to make more efficient use of the world’s dwindling supplies of fossil fuels: transportation systems, industrial applications, and building construction. Includes a case study of energy conservation in Davis County, California.

results.title: Energy: a national issue
results.creator_credit: Gerard H. Baldwin, Ross M Sutherland, Instructional Media and Hanna-Barbera Productions
results.brief_description: Animated film featuring the Flintstones with narration by Charlton Heston to explain the problems of a dwindling energy supply and the means by which to obtain more efficient energy use. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
